result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Wiest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael J. Wiest is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael J. Wiest was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Michael J. Wiest was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Michael J. Wiest was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michael J. Wiest in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney.  Defendant Michael J. Wiest in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pleas previously taken.    State recites joint sentencing recommendation:  W/H - 3 yrs probation - 30 days conditional jail time, Huber, concurrent to 16CF174 and Grant County case 16CF107, but consecutive to any other sentences; AODA and follow through recommendations, no use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, restitution within 30 days, restitution $304.76 to Kwik Trip and $25 to BMO Harrris, counseling as recommended by DOC, DNA submisssion.    Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 2, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jameson R. Whitney in court, defendant Michael J. Wiest not in court, in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant currently in custody in Sauk County.  Defendant was not admitted to alternative court.  Atty Whitney states there is a joint recommendation that will stand, so the request is to schedule a PLEAS asap.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2018 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on February 13, 2018 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Michael J. Wiest in court, in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant vacated.  Warrants issued for FTA.  Defendant is/was represented by Atty Whitney.  Bonds in all cases to remain same, except in 16CF59 - $1000 cash.
Attorney Jameson R. Whitney in court.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to non-appearance, State requests BW.  Ordered.

Defendant Michael J. Wiest in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dane County case is unexpectedly not resolved yet.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on October 24, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Michael J. Wiest in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites joint recommendation:  Cts 2, 4, 6, 8, 10: dismissed. Cts 5 & 7: dismissed, read-in.   Ct 1, 3, 9: plea.  W/H 3 yrs probation, consecutive to any/all jail sentences - 30 days condition time, each count concurrent to each other and to 16CF174 and Grant County #16CF107 but consecutive to any/all other jail sentences; AODA and follow through; no possession or use of any controlled substances without a valid prescription; restitution = $304.76 to Kwik Trip and $25 to BMO Harris; counseling as recommended by DOC; costs (no cps).    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  Defendant sworn by the Clerk.  No contest plea.    Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
